definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: TPC:It allows the spellcaster to telepathically contact someone that they know personally.
sentences.chinese: 它允許施法者通過心靈感應聯接一個他本人認識的人。

sentences.english: He looked as he had showed himself to me telepathically.
sentences.chinese: 他看起來用心靈感應術將他自己展示給我看。

sentences.english: If you hear any thoughts at all, this is telepathy.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能聽到任何想法，這就是心靈感應。

sentences.english: The weapon telepathically whispers to the wearer the name of the power currently stored within it.
sentences.chinese: 該武器通過心靈感應告知持用者其中所儲異能的名稱。

sentences.english: By uncovering the Mayan codes, Arguelles discovered the telepathic nature of time.
sentences.chinese: 由發現瑪雅守則，列斯發現了心靈感應性質時間。

sentences.english: Animal Communicators are trained in listening to animals telepathically .
sentences.chinese: 動物傳心術師是被培訓以心靈感應與動物溝通。

sentences.english: You are an Illusionist and somewhat telepathic.
sentences.chinese: 你是一個魔法師並且小有心靈感應術。

sentences.english: Quaritch uses a psionic link to control the machine.
sentences.chinese: 誇裏奇使用心靈感應來控制它。

sentences.english: You will have a direct telepathic link with mother ships broadcasting to you.
sentences.chinese: 你們將與母船向你們的廣播有直接的心靈感應連接。

sentences.english: You are also ready to crosscheck any guidance that you hear telepathically.
sentences.chinese: 你也準備好交叉測試你心靈感應所聽到的任何引導了。

sentences.english: In some countries, this signal type is called "psychotronic".
sentences.chinese: 在一些國家這種信號形式被稱爲“心靈感應”。

sentences.english: A lot of this information was received telepathically by specific Wise Ones.
sentences.chinese: 很多信息是由智者通過心靈感應接收。

definition: to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
hard to tell if it's real or sham
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
